Comments_List: A deeper knowledge of Islamicate theology and philosophy. But more importantly I learned how to think as a historian of ideas, learned more about identifying good starting point for my research. How to evaluate scholarship, which are general skills that would serve me beyond the course
classical arabic reading skills, understanding of the classical and post-classical arabic philosophical tradition
Methodology, arabic grammar, sharper eye when using primary sources.

The course was very well designed in terms of readings and discussions. It did not overwhelm students with assignments, but instead focused on higher intellectual engagement. One of the best learning experiences so far

More work on resources (encyclopedias, primary sources etc.) to help us in our research. A bit more secondary literature to exemplify further use of primary sources and also to get a broader approach by scholars to the theme of the course.
Yes, with the reasoning given above.
